revised_title: Functional Aspects of Short-Term Visual Memory
tldr: The article discusses the distinction between short-term and long-term visual memory, presenting evidence for a short-term memory for visuo-spatial information that cannot be explained by verbal or sensory representations. The author proposes a classification of information represented in higher visuo-spatial cognition and examines various paradigms for studying short-term visual memory, focusing on the role of visualization in memory for novel patterns.
